availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jefferson J. Chambers (Caldwell co., ky, overseer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and overseer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Sue Gray Chambers. Father of Mary F. Chambers, Thomas W. Chambers, and S. Elvira Chambers. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Overseer for J. A. Cook in Princeton in 1860. Household owned thirty-one enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 356B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 41.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 223B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, District 2, p. 69B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Parkersville, 144, p. 70B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #20774.
